gurmukhi: A`qR C`qR niRp`qR ko qij jog lY sMnXws ] Awn Awn krY lgY hÍY j`qR q`qR audws ]137]
transliteration: Attra Chhttra Nripttra Ko Taj(i) Jog Lai Sannyaas|| Aan Aan Darai Lagad Hvai Jattra Tattra Udaas||137||
translation: They all had forsaken their arms and canopies, had been initiated into Sannyas and Yoga and had come to him as ascetics from all directions and were there at his feet.137.

gurmukhi: ieMdR auipMdR cky sBY icq cauikXo sis Bwn ] lYn d`q Cnwie Awj niRpq mor mhwn ]
transliteration: Indra Oupindra Chake Sabhai Chit Chaoukiyo Sas(i) Bhaan|| Lain Datt Chhanaae Aaj Nripat Mor Mahaan||
translation: Indra, Upendra, Surya, Chandra etc. all marveled in their mind and were thinking that the great Dutt may not seize their kingdom;

gurmukhi: rIJ rIJ rhy jhwN qhwN srb bXom ibmwn ] jwn jwn skY pry gurdyv d`q mhwn ]138]
transliteration: Reejh Reejh Rahe Jahaan Tahaan Sarab Byom Bimaan|| Jaan Jaan Sakai Dare Gurdev Datt Mahaan||138||
translation: All were getting pleased in the sky, sitting in their vehicles and were considering Dutt as the great Guru.138.

gurmukhi: j`qR q`qR idsw ivsw niRp rwj swj ibswr ] Awn Awn sBo ghy pg d`q dyv audwr ]
transliteration: Jattra Tattra Disaa Visaa Nrip Raaj Saaj Bisaar|| Aan Aan Sabho Gade Pag Datt Dev Udaar||
translation: Here and there, in all the directions, the kings, forgetting their royal responsibilities, had caught the feet of the supremely generous Dutt;

gurmukhi: jwn jwn su Drm ko Gr mwn kY gurdyv ] pRIq mwn sBY lgY mn Cwif kY AhMmyv ]139]
transliteration: Jaan Jaan Su Dharam Ko Ghar Maan Kai Gurdev|| Preet Maan Sabhai Lagad Man Chhaad(i) Kaiahanmev||139||
translation: Considering him as the treasure of dharma and the great Guru, all had abandoned their ego and had dedicated themselves affectionately in his service.139.

gurmukhi: rwj swj sBY qjy niRp Bys kY sMnXws ] Awn jog krY lgY hÍYj`qR q`qR audws ]
transliteration: Raaj Saaj Sabhai Taje Nrip Bhes Kai Sannyaas|| Aan Jog Darai Lagad Hvai Jattra Tattra Udaas||
translation: The kings had worn the garb of Sannyas and Yoga, leaving their royal responsibilities and becoming unattached, they had begun the practice of Yoga;

gurmukhi: mMf AMg ibBUq au`jl sIs jUt jtwn ] BwNq BwNqn sO suBy sB rwj pwt inDwn ]140]
transliteration: Mand An Bibhoot Ujjal Sees Jeet Jataan|| Bhaant Bhaantan Sau Soubhe Sabh Raaj Paat Nidhaan||140||
translation: Smearing their bodies with ashes and wearing matted locks on their heads, various types of kings had gathered there.140.

gurmukhi: j`qR q`qR ibswr s`pq puqR imqR kl`qR ] Bys lY sMnXws ko niRp Cwif kY jX p`qR ]
transliteration: Jattra Tattra Bisaar Sanpat Poutra Mitra Kalattara|| Bhes Lai Sannyaas Ko Nrip Chhaad(i) Kai Jaya Pattra||
translation: All the kings, leaving their property, wealth, son friends and the attachment of he queens, their honours and victories, they adopted Sannyas and Yoga and have come there;

gurmukhi: bwj rwj smwj suMdr Cwf kY gjrwj ] Awn Awn bsy mhw bn j`qR q`qR audws ]141]
transliteration: Baaj Raaj Samaaj Soundar Chhaad Kai Gadraaj|| Aan Aan Bade Mahaa Ban Jattra Tattra Udaas||141||
translation: They came and sat there as ascetics here and there gathering together from all directions, leaving behind elephants and horses and their fine society.141.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq srb iCq ky niRpwl ] sMnXws jog lwgy auqwl ] iek krY lwig ilvil Awid krm ] iek Drq iDAwn lY bsqR crm ]142]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Sarab Chit Ke Nripaal|| Sannyaas Jog Laage Outaal|| Ik Darai Laag(i) Lival(i) Aadh Karam|| Ik Dharat Dhiaan Lai Bastra Charam||142||
translation: In this way, all the kings of the earth immediately joined the path of Sannyas and Yoga; someone performed the Neoli Karma (purging of insestines) and someone wearing the garments of hide, was absorbed in meditation.142.

gurmukhi: iek Drq bsqR blkln AMg ] iek rhq klp iesiQq auqMg ] iek krq Alp dugDw Ahwr ] iek rhq brK bhu inrwhwr ]143]
transliteration: Ik Dharat Bastra Balkalan An|| Ik Rahat Kalap Isthit Outan|| Ik Karat Alap Dougdhaa Ahaar|| Ik Rahat Barakh Bahu Niraahaar||143||
translation: Someone is wearing the garments of a recluse and someone is standing straight with a special notion; someone subsists only on milk and someone abides without eating and srinking.143.

gurmukhi: iek rhq mon monI mhwn ] iek krq nXws qij Kwn pwn ] iek rhq eyk pg inrwDwr ] iek bsq gRwm kwnn phwr ]144]
transliteration: Ik Rahat Mon Monimahaan|| Ik Kart Nyaas Taj(i) Khaan Paan|| Ik Rahat Ek Pag Niraadhaar|| Ik Basat Graam Kaanaan Pahaar||144||
translation: Those great saints observed silence and many practiced Yoga without eating and drinking; many stood on one foot without and support and many resided in villages, forests and mountains.144.
